CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 1, 1955, pg. 3, reads: "Starting NAACP Drive - Mrs. Mabel Ryans (right) of 2031 Webster Avenue, requested that the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People forward membership blanks for about fifty new members, all workers at the Eagle Linen Service, and Mrs. Marion B. Jordon (left), executive secretary of the Pittsburgh NAACP Branch, responded. Mrs. Viola Martin, of 7140 Monticello Street, looks on as Mrs. Jordon explains how to fill out the applications. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Marion Bond Jordon signing up Viola Martin and Mabel Ryans for NAACP membership outside of Eagle Linen Supply Company, 141 40th Street, Lawrenceville
CatSubject_tab: Group portraits--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Women--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Uniforms--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Buildings--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Jordon, Marion Bond.National Association for the Advancement of Colored People.
